author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Get IP info

commands.name: infoblox-search-related-objects-by-ip

commands.description: Lists all response policy rules that belong to the given response policy zone.
commands.name: infoblox-list-response-policy-zone-rules

commands.description: List all response policy zones.
commands.name: infoblox-list-response-policy-zones

commands.description: Creates a response policy zone.
commands.name: infoblox-create-response-policy-zone

commands.description: Creates a response policy rule.
commands.name: infoblox-create-rpz-rule

commands.description: Creates a substitute record rule.
commands.name: infoblox-create-a-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Creates a substitute rule for an AAAA record.
commands.name: infoblox-create-aaaa-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Creates a substitute rule for the MX record.
commands.name: infoblox-create-mx-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Creates a substitute rule for a NAPTR record.
commands.name: infoblox-create-naptr-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Creates a substitute rule of the PTR record.
commands.name: infoblox-create-ptr-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Creates a substitute rule of a SRV record.
commands.name: infoblox-create-srv-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Create a substitute rule for a txt record.
commands.name: infoblox-create-txt-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Create a substitute rule for an IPv4 rule.
commands.name: infoblox-create-ipv4-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Creates a substitute of the IPv6 record rule.
commands.name: infoblox-create-ipv6-substitute-record-rule

commands.description: Disables a rule by its reference ID (reference ID could be extracted by running the searah rules command).
commands.name: infoblox-enable-rule

commands.description: Disable a rule by its reference ID (reference ID could be extracted by running the 'infoblox-search-rule' command).
commands.name: infoblox-disable-rule

commands.description: Returns the object fields names which can be used in the search rules command.
commands.name: infoblox-get-object-fields

commands.description: Searches a specific rule by its name.
commands.name: infoblox-search-rule

commands.description: Deletes a rule.
commands.name: infoblox-delete-rpz-rule

commands.description: Deletes a given response policy zone.
commands.name: infoblox-delete-response-policy-zone

integration.description: Infoblox enables you to receive metadata about IPs in your network and manages the DNS Firewall by configuring RPZs. It defines RPZ rules to block DNS resolution for malicious or unauthorized hostnames, or redirect clients to a walled garden by substituting responses.
integration.name: Infoblox

description: Infoblox enables you to receive metadata about IPs in your network and manages the DNS Firewall by configuring RPZs. It defines RPZ rules to block DNS resolution for malicious or unauthorized hostnames, or redirect clients to a walled garden by substituting responses.
name: Infoblox NIOS
readme:
This pack includes XSIAM content.

## Collect Events from Vendor

* Pay attention: Timestamp Parsing is only available in **%Y %b %e %H:%M:%S** format, in UTC (00:00) time zone.

### Broker VM
You will need to use the information described [here](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XDR/Cortex-XDR-Pro-Administrator-Guide/Configure-the-Broker-VM).\
You can configure the specific vendor and product for this instance.
1. Navigate to **Settings** -> **Configuration** -> **Data Broker** -> **Broker VMs**. 
2. Right-click, and select **Syslog Collector** -> **Configure**.
3. When configuring the Syslog Collector, set:
   - vendor as infoblox
   - product as infoblox
